We often get people asking for help, who demand examples from us (on discord).
I recommend adding a bit more of an example here, one which could include an event.

timeline.message:
Minor Changes & Fixes

- Fix version compatibility
- Improve adherence to coding conventions
- Add ability to customize the event item for the enchant prepare event
- Minor doc/pattern changes

timeline.bodyText: should a dash really be an option and should [ed] be optional? enchanted-item is kinda ugly and so is enchant-item. don't think anyone would really try that rather than just having a space
timeline.author: Pikachu920

timeline.bodyText:
skript already has a click type expression - it makes more sense to add support for enchant events to that rather than make a whole new expression

      in

timeline.author: Pikachu920

replies.bodyText: To me, "if the click type is 1" is less clear than "if the clicked enchantment button is 1", but maybe I'm misunderstanding what you mean. Perhaps it would be better to add "clicked enchantment button" to ExprClicked.

enchantment level of enchantment offer 1
than

alright, but to be consistent with other expressions the pattern should be 1st enchantment offer and the number should be an expression otherwise you can't do enchantment offer {_something}

replies.bodyText: So, this expression is actually the cost that was displayed on the side of the enchantment offer. From what I saw in testing, it doesn't actually do anything if you modify it (I'll test again though), so I'm not why it's even modifiable in the first place. However, since the code is pretty much already there, maybe someone will find a use for being able to modify it. I'll clean up the  code & docs on this one.
replies.author: APickledWalrus

timeline.bodyText: instead of a whole expression for this, couldn't you just have this just return an EnchantmentOffer and use the already existing cost expression
timeline.author: Pikachu920

replies.bodyText: Since EnchantmentOffer wasn't added until 1.11, this expression exists to give users on 1.9 / 1.10 some ability to make changes. The word "offer" in this expression is a little misleading.
replies.author: APickledWalrus

replies.bodyText: maybe you could create skript's own EnchantmentOffer and register that on old versions kind of like how ItemType wraps ItemStack and Color wraps Bukkit's color
replies.author: Pikachu920

replies.bodyText: That could be interesting, although this is the only customizable part on 1.9 / 1.10 I believe.
replies.author: APickledWalrus

timeline.bodyText: exprOfferNumber may be null, this could cause an NPE
timeline.author: Pikachu920

timeline.bodyText: new EnchantmentOffer[0];
timeline.author: Pikachu920

replies.bodyText: also wouldn't it make more sense to just check the length of the offer array? just because this is the length now doesn't mean it will be in the future
replies.author: Pikachu920

replies.bodyText: I will have to change that. There could be 0-3 offers, so I'll have to account for that.
replies.author: APickledWalrus

timeline.bodyText: wouldn't this mean you can't do add -1 to player's level to a level 1 player and get 0?
timeline.author: Pikachu920

replies.bodyText: This check is to just make sure the level isn't being set to a number < 1, because you aren't able to do that. However, I will add some comments for clarity.
